EVA

Visual data management system. Features include declarative query language, storage management, deep learning, and hardware acceleration. Developed at Georgia Institute of Technology.

EVA (Exploratory Video Analytics)

What is EVA?

EVA is a visual data management system (think MySQL for videos). It supports a declarative language similar to SQL and a wide range of commonly used computer vision models.

What does EVA do?

  • EVA enables querying of visual data in user facing applications by providing a simple SQL-like interface for a wide range of commonly used computer vision models.

  • EVA improves throughput by introducing sampling, filtering, and caching techniques.

  • EVA improves accuracy by introducing state-of-the-art model specialization and selection algorithms.

Architecture

EVA consists of four core components:

  • EVAQL Query Parser
  • Query Optimizer
  • Query Execution Engine (Filters + Deep Learning Models)
  • Distributed Storage Engine

Contributing

To file a bug or request a feature, please file a GitHub issue. Pull requests are welcome.
